word:
Defective Elimination. 
     891. The studied habit of shunning the air and avoiding exercise closes the pores, . . . making it impossible to throw off impurities through that channel. The burden of labor is thrown upon the liver, lungs, kidneys, etc., and these internal organs are compelled to do the work of the skin. Thus persons bring diseases upon themselves by their wrong habits.-- T., V. II, p. 524.
